executive_summary: The Daily Deals Sites industry has experienced relatively steady growth over the five years to 2021, with revenue rising at an annualized rate of 4.0% to $5.6 billion, including an increase of 6.3% in 2021 alone. Overall increases in consumer spending, coupled with rising internet connectivity, facilitated growth in daily deal sites early during the five-year period. However, low barriers to entry, high marketing costs and steep competition have prevented most companies from gaining a foothold in the industry.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Daily Deals Sites industry has experienced rapid growth over the majority of the five years to 2021, despite some significant growing pains. By appealing to customers who are interested in experiences and consumer goods at discount prices, the industry is expected to increase an annualized 4.0% to $5.6 billion during the five-year period, including an increase of 6.3% in 2021 alone.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the five years to 2026, IBISWorld projects that industry revenue will increase at an annualized rate of 3.3% to $6.5 billion. Industry revenue growth is expected to slow compared with the previous five years, as per capita disposable income continues to grow and consumer spending rebounds amid economy recovery following the coronavirus.

industry_definition: This industry includes operators that generate the majority of their revenue through discounts on local goods and services for a limited time frame. Goods sold by the website are given as vouchers that consumers can redeem at local merchants for the physical good or service.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - increasing

key_trends: The proliferation of mobile internet connections has provided a platform for growth and deals on the go
The industry's low barriers to entry enticed many new players to enter the industry
As a rush of new players entered the market, the industry quickly reached saturation
The industry is expected to benefit from increased consumer spending and an increase in travel and events as restrictions ease
External competition is expected to keep growth modest
Mobile growth reflects a continued industry shift from push promotions to a pull marketing model
Heightened competition has reduced the number of daily deal sites in recent years

market_segmentation.segment_description: Consumers aged 55 and over are anticipated to account for an estimated 24.3% of industry revenue in 2021. Their limited use of smartphones and the internet also restricts their activity on daily deals websites. Even so, the rapid adoption of technology by this demographic will result in this segment expanding share of revenue over the next five years.

Consumers aged 25 to 34 represent the second largest market segment for the Daily Deals Sites industry, accounting for an estimated 23.5% of revenue in 2021. Since many coupons featured on these websites fall under the health and beauty label, the consumer base largely reflects these industries' buyers.

Consumers aged 35 to 44 account for 19.2% of revenue in 2021. These consumers have more established careers and incomes, enabling them to purchase higher-priced products and services. Therefore, their demand for daily deal websites is not as high as that of consumers who are 25 to 34.
Consumers who are 45 to 54 are less likely to use daily deals websites because they generally earn higher incomes and can purchase the products and services featured on the sites at full price.

Consumers aged 24 and younger are expected to account for 13.5% of revenue for the Daily Deals Sites industry in 2021. The vast majority of revenue from this segment is generated from individuals aged 20 to 24. Individuals in this group typically have lower incomes than their older cohorts.

products_and_services.product_description: Daily deals sites also feature services that fall under the travel category.

Local event deals are expected to account for 64.9% of revenue for the Daily Deals Sites industry in 2021. Local deals include vouchers to restaurants, fitness classes, spas and tickets to social events.
Daily deals sites offer coupons and vouchers to subscribers and users. In addition, they are limited time deals on consumer goods ranging from electronics to clothing.

tier_2_buyers: Accommodation and Food Services in the US
Hair & Nail Salons in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Demand for coupons and vouchers purchased through daily deals websites depends on consumer purchasing power and willingness
demand_determinants.determinant_description: A high unemployment rate often causes consumers to seek out cheaper alternatives for their usual purchases; daily deals websites are attractive during periods of high unemployment because they offer discounts to cash-strapped consumers. Similarly, low per capita disposable income boosts demand for daily deals websites, because it leads consumers to seek out more price-conscious options.

international_trade_points.trade_title: International trade is not recorded at the retail level
international_trade_points.trade_description: International trade is not recorded at the retail level, by convention. While goods sold through websites in the Daily Deals Sites industry may be sourced from foreign suppliers, their international exchange value is recorded in the corresponding manufacturing industry.

business_locations.location_description: The West region has the highest percentage of establishments at around 24.7%, followed by the Southeast at 21.7%, the Mid-Atlantic at 17.0%, and the Great Lakes at 11.2%. However, the population distribution across these regions does not follow the same pattern as the establishment distribution.

The Southeast, despite being home to the most inhabited region with 25.8% of the population, has fewer industry establishments per person than the West, which has 17.2% of the population. The main reason for this distribution of establishments is that online sellers typically want to keep their warehouses near major import or export centers.

The Mid-Atlantic region is popular with industry operators because of its proximity to trade across the Atlantic. California, Florida and New York account for the most significant share of industry presence and a large portion of the population; these states have several large cities, which are hubs for consumer activity.
The Great Lakes region is popular with industry operators because of its proximity to Canada, one of the United States' major trading partners and because land for warehouses is inexpensive.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Regulation for the Daily Deals Sites industry is low and primarily focuses on user privacy and security.
The Entertainment Software Rating Board (ESRB) has established an Online Privacy Program to help members meet complex privacy rules for internet applications under COPPA.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Industry is highly competitive and fragmented
barriers_points.barrier_description: Several companies with copycat business models are entering the industry to compete with established companies.

Industry participation is expected to have increased at an annualized 15.0% to 2,264 businesses over the five years to 2021, giving way to more competition as the market becomes increasingly saturated.

Industry leaders Groupon Inc. and Rue Gilt Groupe have been able to scale and export their business models to numerous local markets internationally, offer higher volumes of relevant and discounted deals, have strong brand recognition, and financial backing from institutional investors, giving them significant competitive advantages over new entrants.

basis_points.basis_description: Companies compete internally on size of subscriber and merchant bases, local presence and understanding, ability to offer high volume of relevant deals, subscriber purchase rate, value-added to merchants, and brand recognition.
Companies face external competition from large internet and technology businesses like Yelp that offer competing initiatives, as well as traditional offline coupon and discount services.
Companies compete to hire, retain and incentivize highly skilled programmers and sales professionals needed to grow their businesses.
Companies with backing from institutional investors and additional lines of credit have a significant competitive advantage since most enterprises operate at a loss.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Top two companies account for 23.4% market share
concentration_points.concentration_description: The top two companies, Groupon Inc. and Rue Gilt Groupe, are estimated to account for 23.4% of industry revenue in 2021.
These companies were among the first to enter the market and were able to scale and export their business models faster than competitors.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Leaders have strong brands and financial backing
concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry leaders have strong brand recognition and institutional investor backing, which has enabled them to grow subscriber and merchant bases worldwide.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Given the industry's tempering growth and the opportunistic marketing efforts of operators, marketing's proportion of the cost structure is disproportionately high compared with other industries.
The money that is passed onto clients is not reported in this cost structure. Industry operators act as intermediaries between consumers and brands, restaurants, and hotels.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Capital intensity for the Daily Deals Sites industry is low. For every $1.00 spent on labor, about $0.06 is allocated toward capital expenses.
Expenditure on website and smartphone application development and on computers and software determines capital costs.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Revenue expansion over the five years to 2021 reflects the rapid rise and saturation of the industry, leading to volatility.
Due to unfavorable operating conditions in 2020 from the COVID-19 pandemic, industry revenue was pressured.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Operators have been able to leverage new software technology to create better mobile applications and use AI for targeted ads.
A crucial element is the security of payment systems that facilitate transactions, partnering with established secure systems.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Companies offer deals on a range of product, from travel vouchers, to restaurant deals and discounted consumer goods.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: While companies may fare better than other retailers in times of economic downturn, services and products offered are for the most part discretionary. Therefore, when disposable income levels decline, demand for industry products and services declines in line.

FAQs.question: What steps do you take to retain talented employees with specialized knowledge?
FAQs.answer: Companies offer specialized employees, such as engineers, premium wages to ensure they stay at the company and continue to help build online platforms.

FAQs.question: Do you contract directly with manufacturers in order to reduce purchase costs?
FAQs.answer: December 2021, the Retail Trade sector accounted for just under 7.8% of all approved PPP loans. Industry operators are part of the Retail Trade sector, and therefore, it is likely, especially among smaller operators, that the industry will benefit from increased federal funding. Companies in this industry act as intermediaries between retailers, hotel and restaurant owners, as well as travel agencies and consumers.

FAQs.question: Does your company use point-of-sale (POS) systems to ensure that the most popular products are kept in stock?
FAQs.answer: Operators use POS systems in their warehouses in order to keep their online site and mobile app up-to-date with product and voucher quantities.

FAQs.question: How has your company reacted to the rise of online sales over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Operators have benefited from the rise of online sales since this industry exclusively operates online.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Companies comply with federal, state and local health and safety requirements in their product warehouses and office headquarters. The COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic increased regulations including social distancing, mask mandates and increased cleaning and sanitation procedures.

FAQs.question: What does your company do to remain compliant with new consumer regulations?
FAQs.answer: Companies work with industry associations, such as eDeal, to stay up-to-date with new consumer regulations.

FAQs.question: Do you have any challenges with customers paying on time?
FAQs.answer: Companies typically charge the consumer's card on file with the membership immediately after the purchase, rather than through a payment plan, so there is relatively little issue with customers not paying on time.

FAQs.question: What ongoing financing challenges does your company face?
FAQs.answer: Companies have had a difficult type increasing profit margins because they only take a percentage of the sale because they work with retailers and business owners to sell products at discounted prices that would have otherwise not been sold.

FAQs.question: How do you differentiate your products from your competitors? Do you use innovative marketing to make your product stand out?
FAQs.answer: Successful players will be able to drive revenue growth through effective advertising and marketing initiatives.

FAQs.question: Do you operate on a membership or subscription basis?
How do you find the best deals for your customers?
FAQs.answer: Due to the discounted nature of vouchers sold by this industry, players must ensure that pricing is competitive and represents value to consumers.

FAQs.question: How does your coverage compare with that of your competitors? Are there some areas in which it is harder to provide service?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators must move into new geographic areas to increase the size of their potential market.

FAQs.question: How will you contend with increasing disposable income over the coming years? Do you use pull or push marketing to expand your reach?
FAQs.answer: During periods of low disposable income, households often look for discount products and services, leading to higher demand for daily deals sites. Per capita disposable income is expected to increase in 2021.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor unemployment rates to plan your business accordingly? How has rising unemployment affected your business in the past?
FAQs.answer: When unemployment rises, consumers typically attempt to save money and use daily deals websites that offer discounted products and services. The national unemployment rate is expected to decrease in 2021, following a significant rise in 2020 due to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.

FAQs.question: How can you capitalize on an increasing number of mobile internet connections? Do you offer a smartphone app to expand your reach?
FAQs.answer: Mobile internet connections enable consumers to search daily deals sites from almost any location. An increase in the number of mobile internet connections increases the pool of potential voucher purchasers. The number of mobile internet connections is expected to increase in 2021.
